questions.question: 1.  Karol had a meal that cost $16.00. She tipped the waiter 20% of that amount for service. How much was the tip ?
2. The price of a pumpkin is directly proportional to its weight. If a pumpkin that weighs 15 pounds costs $3.25, how much will a 10.4-pound pumpkin cost?
3.  If , then ?

4. Neka earns his regular pay of $9.00 per hour for up to 40 hours of work in a week. For each hour over 40 hours of work in a week, Neka is paid  times his regular pay.  How much does Neka earn for a week in which he works 43 hours ?
5. To attend an annual banquet, members pay $13 per ticket while nonmembers pay $15 per ticket.  What is the total amount, in dollars, from the sale of 90 member tickets and n nonmember tickets?
6. What is the volume, in cubic centimeters, of a rectangular solid that is 10 cm wide, 20 cm long, and14 cm tall?
7.  If a = 3, b = -5, and c = 4, then 2a²b - 5ac² = ?

20. Use the following information to answer questions 20-22.A contractor is building a garage onto the end of a house. The house consists of a triangular prism resting on top of a rectangular prism, as shown in the figure below, The roof of the house is formed by 2 congruent rectangles that are joined at the ridge. The house and the garage are geometrically similar, with each dimension of the garage the corresponding dimension of the house. Some of the lengths of the house, in feet, are as follows:The contractor will use shingles that cost ＄21 per bundle to cover the roof of the garage. Each 1-gallon can of paint used to paint the inside walls and ceiling of the garage covers exactly 400 square feet with 1 coat of paint.20. What is the height of the garage, AC, in feet ?

21. Use the following information to answer questions 20-22.A contractor is building a garage onto the end of a house. The house consists of a triangular prism resting on top of a rectangular prism, as shown in the figure below, The roof of the house is formed by 2 congruent rectangles that are joined at the ridge. The house and the garage are geometrically similar, with each dimension of the garage the corresponding dimension of the house. Some of the lengths of the house, in feet, are as follows:The contractor will use shingles that cost ＄21 per bundle to cover the roof of the garage. The contractor determines that 36 bundles of shingles arc needed to cover the surface of the roof of the garage. What is the price the contractor will pay for these shingles?

22. Use the following information to answer questions 20-22.A contractor is building a garage onto the end of a house. The house consists of a triangular prism resting on top of a rectangular prism, as shown in the figure below, The roof of the house is formed by 2 congruent rectangles that are joined at the ridge. The house and the garage are geometrically similar, with each dimension of the garage the corresponding dimension of the house. Some of the lengths of the house, in feet, are as follows:The contractor will use shingles that cost ＄21 per bundle to cover the roof of the garage. 23. On a wristwatch, shown below, the hour hand rotates 30° per hour and the minute hand rotates 360° per hour. How many degrees will the hour hand of the wristwatch rotate from 6:00 p.m. to 6:42 p.m. on the same day?

The table below gives the exam scores, in points, for 5 of 6 students in each of 3 groups in Computer Skills.26. The table below gives the exam scores, in points, for 5 of 6 students in each of 3 groups in Computer Skills.27. 28. Use the following information to answer questions 26-28.The first exam in Computer Skills is worth 100 points. Each exam score earned is a whole number of points. The table below gives the exam scores, in points, for 5 of 6 students in each of 3 groups in Computer Skills.28. After the 6th student in each group takes the exam, an average score will be calculated for each group. Suppose the 6th student in Group B earns 100 points on her exam. What is the minimum exam score, in points, the 6th student in Group A would need to earn for Group A to have a higher average exam score than Group B with the 6th score?

29.  The points A, B,  and D  are collinear, B  is between A and D,  and C  is a point not on .  Which of the following statements about the measures of the angles formed must  be true?

choices.A: The measure of ∠ABC  is more than 90°.
choices.B: The measure of ∠ABC  is less than 90°.
choices.D: The sum of the measures of ∠ABC  and ∠CBD  is 180°.
choices.E: The sum of the measures of ∠ABC  and ∠CBD  is 90°.

questions.question: 31. The quadratic equation  can be solved by factoring. Which of the following states the solutions?

32. Which of the following statements is a logical conclusion from the 3 true statements given below?
       All meeps are smools.
       All larps are smools.
       All blins are meeps.

34. What is the least common multiple of 70, 110, and 60 ?
35. What is the y-intercept of the graph of 3x + 2y = 12 in the standard (x, y) coordinate plane?

36. When running at 64% of its potential power, an aircraft engine consumes fuel at a rate of 11.5 gallons per hour. When running at 70% of its potential power, the engine consumes fuel at a rate of 14.7 gallons per hour. The rate of fuel consumption is linearly related to the percent of potential power. Which of the following is the best estimate of the fuel consumption of the aircraft engine, in gallons per hour, when running at 60% of its potential power?
37. Sandy is building a fence for her rectangular yard. A diagram of the yard is shown below. Which of the following expressions gives the perimeter of Sandy's yard?

38. Mrs. Esposito owns a rabbit farm. Using past data, she developed an expression, , that models her farm's rabbit population in t years. According to Mrs. Esposito's model, what will be her farm's rabbit population in 4 years?

39. Two copy machines copy at the same rate and will both be used to make copies of a report. At 8:00 a.m., both machines begin copying. One of the machines breaks down at 11:00 a.m. and begins copying again at 2:00 p.m. Both machines finish copying at 5:00 p.m. when the copying of the report is complete. One of the following graphs shows n, the number of copies made, as a function of t, the time at any given point during the copying. Which graph is it?

40. Consider the 4th-degree polynomial function graphed in the standard (x, y) coordinate plane below. The function has a local maximum at b, local minimums at a and d, and x-intercepts at a, c, and e. On what interval(s) of x is the function increasing?

choices.A: From negative infinity to positive infinity
choices.B: From negative infinity to a and from b to d
choices.C: From negative infinity to c and from e to positive infinity
choices.D: From a to b and from d to positive infinity

questions.question: 41. Point A(2, 1) is on a circle centered at (5, -1) in the standard (x, y) coordinate plane. What are the coordinates of the other end of the diameter through A ?

questions.question: 47. Keisha's weight does not vary more than 5 pounds from p pounds. Which of the following inequalities gives the range of Keisha's weight, w, in pounds?

48. A surveyor is finding the dimensions of the triangular lot shown below. The length of 1 side is 80 feet. Which of the following is an expression for the length, in feet, of the side of the lot opposite the 110° angle?(Note: The law of sines states that in every triangle, the ratio of a side's length to the sine of the angle opposite that side is equal for all 3 sides.)
